greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 1/(1 - 3*x^2 + x^4).
comment: S(n,sqrt(5)), with the Chebyshev polynomials A049310, is an integer sequence in the real quadratic number field Q(sqrt(5)) with basis numbers <1,phi>, phi:=(1+sqrt(5))/2 . S(n,sqrt(5)) = A(n) + 2*B(n)*phi, with A(n)=A005013(n+1)*(-1)^n and B(n)=a(n-1), n>=0, with a(-1):=0. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 24 2010
The sequence (s(n)) given by s(0) = 0 and s(n) = a(n-1) for n > 0 is the p-INVERT of (0,1,0,1,0,1,..) using p(S) = 1 - S^2; see A291219. - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 30 2017
Consider this array of successive differences:
First row = even index Fibonacci numbers with interleaved zeroes = this sequence right-shifted 3 positions.
First upper subdiagonal = 0,1,4,17,72,305,1292,... = A001076 right shifted.
(End) (Comment based on an e-mail from Paul Curtz)
link: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,3,0,-1).
formula: a(n) + a(n-1) + a(n-2) = A005013(n + 1). - _Michael Somos_, Apr 13 2012
mathematica: f[x_] = x^2-x-1; g[x] = ExpandAll[ -f[x]*x^2*f[1/x]]; a = Table[SeriesCoefficient[Series[1/g[x], {x, 0, 50}], n], {n, 0, 50}]
program: (PARI) Vec(1/(1 - 3*x^2 + x^4)+O(x^99)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 23 2012
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Nov 08 2008
